item.title: Abstraction
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

I have this in the super-class.

And I want to be able to fill that array with different Items per class that extends the super-class.

[code]public class AlKharidGeneralStore extends Shops {

public static final Item[] DEFAULT_STOCK = new Item[] { new Item(1931, 3),
                new Item(1935, 2), new Item(5603, 2), new Item(1925, 2),
                new Item(590, 2), new Item(1755, 2), new Item(2347, 5) };

}[/code]

The only problem is that, that field is hiding the field in the super-class. And I can’t think of a way to override it, yet I need to be able to somehow reference it from the super-class. I would normally do that with making it abstract, yet I don’t think you can make objects abstract. Only methods, correct? How would I go about doing this…?

Read full topic
